Related publications are listed in the metadata section of the Dataverse study.

fields.value: Training beneficiaries in the PABRA Project

datasetContactAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

dsDescriptionValue.value: Pan African Bean Research Alliance (PABRA) specifically invests finance, human resource and time in ensuring that the continents bean researchers and staff are up to date and relevant with skills they require. The data sets presented here have been assembled from multiple sources to provide and indicative position of skill and knowledge building initiatives by PABRA and its various partners. The data sets show the number of people trained between the year 2003 t0 2016. Though the data sets provide the numbers, discussion on capacity building as a whole is available in the capacity building section of the PABRA website.

publicationCitation.value: Muthoni Andriatsitohaina, Rachel; Miiro, Richard Fred. 2016. What influences transfer of training in an African agricultural research network? The Journal of Agricultural Education and Extension 1-15 p.

Miiro, Richard; Muthoni-Andriatsitohaina, Rachel; Mukankusi, Claire. 2016. Bean breeding by the Pan African Bean Research Alliance: Trainer explanations of training Results . Centro Internacional de Agricultura Tropical (CIAT); Pan-Africa Bean Research Alliance (PABRA), Livingstone. 1 p. (Poster presented at Pan-African Grain Legume & World Cowpea Conference. Livingstone, Zambia, 27 February - 4 March 2016).

country.value: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the

files.description:
The datasets show the number of trainings that have been conducted by dominant themes in the period 2013 to 2016. The values are in % for each represented theme. 
Note:  The values between 2003 and 2008 are significantly low because the effort on data capture was biased towards training of partners and scientist. However in 2009-2006 this was expanded to capture training to levels as low as farmers.
Refer to codebook for variable definitions
files.label: 02 PABRA Training by Theme Data.tab

dataFile.description:
The datasets show the number of trainings that have been conducted by dominant themes in the period 2013 to 2016. The values are in % for each represented theme. 
Note:  The values between 2003 and 2008 are significantly low because the effort on data capture was biased towards training of partners and scientist. However in 2009-2006 this was expanded to capture training to levels as low as farmers.
Refer to codebook for variable definitions

files.description: This data set shows the categories of Training of Trainers (ToT), Extensionist/Farmers and Students by men and women. It applies to data where such data was available and hence does not apply to all training beneficiaries.  The value presented as Not Available (N/A) means that in that there was no data collected in that particular year. The values presented shows the percentage of Male-Female trained in each of the categories
files.label: 03 Gender Categorized Training.tab

dataFile.description: This data set shows the categories of Training of Trainers (ToT), Extensionist/Farmers and Students by men and women. It applies to data where such data was available and hence does not apply to all training beneficiaries.  The value presented as Not Available (N/A) means that in that there was no data collected in that particular year. The values presented shows the percentage of Male-Female trained in each of the categories

files.description:
The thematic trainings in PABRA can be categorized in 3 mutually inclusive and re-enforcing categories of Formal Training of Trainers (ToT), Extentionists/Farmers and Students. 
•	Training of Trainers (ToT): - Trainings by PABRA –CIAT researchers and partners that aim to equip trainers with skills with the intent to further train others. 
•	Extensionists and Farmers: These are trainings targeting farmers, extensionists, and value chain actors. These training are usually conducted by partners during project activities.
•	Students: These are students from diverse themes at Bsc, Masters and PHD.
•	Overall % of Women: This shows the overall percentage of women that have been trained across the 3 categories (Training of Trainers, Extentionist and farmers and students) 
Refer to codebook for variable definitions
files.label: 04 PABRA Trainings by Category.tab

dataFile.description:
The thematic trainings in PABRA can be categorized in 3 mutually inclusive and re-enforcing categories of Formal Training of Trainers (ToT), Extentionists/Farmers and Students. 
•	Training of Trainers (ToT): - Trainings by PABRA –CIAT researchers and partners that aim to equip trainers with skills with the intent to further train others. 
•	Extensionists and Farmers: These are trainings targeting farmers, extensionists, and value chain actors. These training are usually conducted by partners during project activities.
•	Students: These are students from diverse themes at Bsc, Masters and PHD.
•	Overall % of Women: This shows the overall percentage of women that have been trained across the 3 categories (Training of Trainers, Extentionist and farmers and students) 
Refer to codebook for variable definitions
